column4: How do I discover which codec is attributed to a .avi file in ubuntu?
If I play it in mplayer the screen goes all pink :(
righto, divX 5, thanks. How do I force mplayer to use that?
it will automatically if it's supported. see if "mplayer -vo x11 filename.avi" also give you the pink tone.
it doesnt thanks. But I cant set it on full screen, I get black bars all around. Can't I tell it to "stretch out"?
tricky question. make sure /etc/lirc/hardware.conf has got the correct LIRCD_ARGS. example, I need to use LIRCD_ARGS="-H dev/input -d /dev/input/event0 /etc/lirc/lircd.conf" for appleir controller.
might be as easy as to find the correct /dev/input/eventX to use. that is specific to your hardware...
how do I find such event? :P
Myself, I experimented. But I think it's best to google for an example /etc/lirc/hardware.conf for your controller.
so its hardware.conf I need to configure for my device, not lircd.conf?
hardware.conf maps to the correct device. lircd.conf contain the key bindings. lircmd.conf I don't use at all.
perhaps there is a lirc irc channel if you're lucky.
perhaps this page can help you https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InstallLirc/Gutsy
